intro: Erigeron varius, commonly known as the variable fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as fields, roadsides, and disturbed areas, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, with a serrated edge, while the flowers are typically white or pale blue. Erigeron varius is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
